text: Arnie W. "Woo-Woo" Ginsburg (August 5, 1926 â€“ June 26, 2020) was an American disc jockey. He worked for the Boston radio market from the mid-1950s to the 1970s. Following this period, he became involved in the business side of radio as a business manager, president and owner of WVJV-TV."New Competitor to MTV, Local Radio Stations?" Los Angeles Times, April 7, 1986, p. G9. He later was an executive with Pyramid Broadcasting and program manager of their Boston station WXKS/1430.Jennifer Bingham Hull. "Their Music is Back, So Older Listeners Play the Radio Again." Wall Street Journal, April 13, 1982, p. 1. ==Notes== Category:1926 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American DJs Category:Musicians from Boston Category:Businesspeople from Boston Category:People from Brookline, Massachusetts
title: Arnie Ginsburg
